snippet: Russia showed no hint of heeding Western demands to avoid bombing of fighters pushing to oust Syria’s weakened, Kremlin-backed president, Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Pres Obama reacts to much more complex situation in Syria as Russian airstrikes increase to largest scale to date and Iran commits more combat troops to effort to support Pres Bashar al-Assad; says such efforts to bolster Assad will ultimately fail.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow. Reporting was contributed by Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon; Eric Schmitt from Washington; Michael R. Gordon and Rick Gladstone from New York; and Adam Nossiter and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Russia showed no hint of heeding Western demands to avoid bombing of fighters pushing to oust Syria’s weakened, Kremlin-backed president, Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Obama Sees Russia Failing in Syria Effort
headline.print_headline: Obama Sees Russia Failing in Syria Effort

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
